department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Yu, with cover, of black pottery with small Tao Chi mask on each side. Top of cover, with simple knob finial, decorated with incised lines and two minute portruding wedge-shaped bosses; coating of clay on inside and thin deposit on outside.
text: This lidded jar is made from clay, but it closely resembles a yu bronze ceremonial wine container. A small animal mask has been carved in the center near the rim of the otherwise smooth vessel, making it similar to early Zhou ritual bronzes.
title: Yu lidded jar
